data.title: Lane College Graduation Rate & Retention Rate
data.meta_description: Learn Lane College graduation and retention rates to find out how many students are progressing and graduating on time at Lane College, as well as how many drop out or transfer.

Lane College Graduation Rate & Retention Rates

10% 4-Year Graduation Rate25% 6-Year Graduation Rate55% Retention Rate

Lane College 2023 Graduation & Retention Report

How long does it take to earn a degree at Lane College? Find out how many students return after their freshman year, how long it takes to graduate, and what happens to the students who don't.

Lane College Retention RateLane College Graduation Rate

First Time Undergrads Attending Full TimeFirst Time Undergrads Attending Part TimeNon-First Time Undergrads Attending Full TimeNon-First Time Undergrads Attending Part Time

Lane College Drop Out RateMethodology & References

Lane College Retention Rate

55% Freshmen Retention RateBelow Average Retention Rate

Freshmen retention rate refers to the percentage of first-time / full-time students who return for their second year.

With 55% students making it past their freshmen year, Lane College has freshmen retention rates similar to the national average.

Nationwide, the average first to second year retention rate is 70.57%.

When looking at just colleges and universities in Tennessee, the average is 71.48%.

Low retention rates may be a signal that a lot of students plan on transferring after a year or two. Is that the case here?

Lane College Graduation Rates

25% 6-Year Graduation Rate42.61% Transfer Rate30.75% Dropout Rate

There were approximately 213 students in the class of 2015. How many of them actually completed their degree in a timely fashion?

After four years 10% of the cohort graduated. After six years 25% had completed their degree, and 26% after eight years.

The official graduation rate of Lane College is 25%. This is the percentage of students who completed their degree within 150% of the published time. That means six years for a standard bachelor's degree program.

The average Lane College student takes 4.57 years to graduate with their bachelors.

Lane College Graduation Rates vs. National Average

The non-completers rate is anyone who is not still enrolled at the institution after eight years. Both transfer students and drop-outs could be included in this group.

Request More Info About Lane College >

Lane College Drop Out Rate

Approximately 629 students or 74% of the cohort did not complete their degree within eight years.

What happened to the 629 students who did not complete their degree?

0 are still enrolled.

363 transferred to another institution.

Lane College lost contact with the remaining 262 who we assumed dropped out.

Lane College Graduation Rates by Race/Ethnicity

Some Students Take More Time To Graduate

Some schools have mainly first-time, full-time students, while others cater to part-time students, transfer students, or adult learners. For a variety of reasons first-time, full-time students under the age of 25 are usually more likely to graduate in four years.

Traditional Students:

First-time, full-time students under the age of 25.

Non-Traditional Students:

Any student that is not first-time, full-time, and under the age of 25.

The majority of students at Lane College are considered 'traditional students' who are first-time attending full-time.

Comparing the graduation rates of specific cohorts shown below will be more revealing than the overall statistics shared above.

First-Time / Full-Time Lane College Graduation Rates

77% First-Time, Full-Time20% 6-Year Grad RateLow Grad Rate

First-time / full-time students at Lane College represent 77% of the students in the class of 2015, and 62.44% of Lane College bachelor's degree graduations.

With a four-year graduation rate of 10%, first-time students in the Lane College class of 2015 who attended classes full-time were less likely than average to graduate on time.

After six years, the Lane College graduation rate was 20%, and by the eight year mark, 21% of the cohort had completed their degree.

Nationwide, the average graduation rate for first-time undergraduates attending classes full-time is 37.92% after four years, 46.43% after six years, and 47.82% after eight years.

Lane College First-Time / Full-Time Graduation Rate vs. National Average

First-Time / Full-Time Lane College Drop Out Rates

519 first-time / full-time students or 79% did not complete their degree within eight years.

Of those who did not finish:

0 are still enrolled.

304 transferred to another institution.

Lane College lost contact with the remaining 211 who we assumed dropped out.

First-Time / Part-Time Graduation Rates

0% First-Time, Part-Time

First-time / part-time students at Lane College represent 0.12% of the students in the class of 2015.

First-Time / Part-Time Lane College Graduation Rates vs. National Average

First-Time / Part-Time Lane College Drop Out Rates

1 first-time / part-time students or 100% did not complete their degree within eight years.

Of those who did not finish:

0 are still enrolled.

0 transferred to another institution.

Lane College lost contact with the remaining 1 who we assumed dropped out.

Non First-Time / Full-Time Students

22% Returning, Full-Time42% 6-Year Grad RateLow Grad Rate

189 Lane College students were classified as full-time / not first-time. This represents 22.18% of the students in the class of 2015.

Non first-time students could include transfer students or adults who have returned to school after an absense.

With a six year graduation rate of 42%, returning students in the class of 2015 and attended classes full-time had a graduation rate lower than the national average for students in this category.

After eight years, the graduation rate was 43%.

Nationwide, the average graduation rate for non first-time undergraduates attending classes full-time is: 49.57% after four years, 53.83% after six years, and 55.07% after eight years.

Lane College Non First-Time / Full-Time Graduation Rate vs. National Average

Non First-Time / Full-Time Lane College Drop Out Rates

107 non first-time / part-time students or 57% did not complete their degree within eight years.

Of those who did not finish:

0 are still enrolled.

58 transferred to another institution.

Lane College lost contact with the remaining 49 who we assumed dropped out.

Non First-Time / Part-Time Graduation Rates

0% Returning, Part-Time33% 6-Year Grad RateGood Grad Rate

3 Lane College students were classified as full-time / not first-time. This represents 0.35% of the students in the class of 2015.

With a six year graduation rate of 33%, returning students in the class of 2015 and attended classes full-time had a graduation rate lower than the national average.

After eight years, the graduation rate was 33%.

Nationwide, the average graduation rate for non first-time undergraduates attending classes part-time is: 36.03% after six years, 36.03% after eight years.

Lane College Non First-Time / Part-Time Graduation Rate vs. National Average

Non First-Time / Part-Time Lane College Drop Out Rates

2 non first-time / part-time students or 67% did not complete their degree within eight years.

Of those who did not finish:

0 are still enrolled.

1 transferred to another institution.

Lane College lost contact with the remaining 1 who we assumed dropped out.
